summary:
The CIS is a group of countries in Eurasia that formed after the Soviet Union split in 1991. It includes many former Soviet republics and aims to help these countries work together on things like trade, laws, and security. 

Originally, three countries—Belarus, Russia, and Ukraine—created the CIS. Over time, some countries like Georgia and Ukraine left due to conflicts with Russia. The CIS has nine members, and most of them are part of a free trade area. Some members also belong to other groups, like the Eurasian Economic Union, which works on economic and military matters.
title: Commonwealth of Independent States
